cont.entity_a: Despite frequent drops and cosmetic damage.
Mouse battery life is approximately two weeks. Keyboard still functions well with a battery life of about six months. Batteries deplete faster if devices are not switched off. Good battery life.
cont.entity_b: Battery life for mouse is short; rechargeable batteries recommended. Wireless setup offers good range and battery life.

cont.entity_a: Compatible with Android 4 tablet and Windows 7 64-bit. Compatible with Windows MediaCenter 2005.
cont.entity_b: Works well with Vista without downloading drivers from the disk. Installation was quick and simple, compatible at BIOS level.

cont.entity_a: Bluetooth adapter lacks support for audio devices, limited to keyboard and mouse use. Works well for operating a PC connected to a TV, with excellent range and ease of use. Range exceeds 30 feet, easy setup, includes a mouse recharging cradle. Lag occurs from first keypress or mouse movement after power-on. Bluetooth keyboard with touchpad is suitable for lap use.
cont.entity_b: Seamless switching between multiple PCs with KVM. Software allows extensive customization of keys. Keyboard features extra programmable keys and a clock/timer. Keyboard has a dynamic zoom bar that is finicky.

cont.entity_a: Lacks a number pad, touch-sensitive function keys are overly sensitive. Design lacks ergonomic features, not ideal for extended typing sessions.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable design. Mouse is not ideal for left-hand use due to design.

cont.entity_a: Low profile and not suitable for heavy typing due to minimal key travel and touch-sensitive keys.
cont.entity_b: Keyboards have a soft touch and quiet keys.

cont.entity_a: Stopped working after three years, potentially due to being dropped. Lightweight and responsive.
cont.entity_b: Works on most surfaces but could be larger for comfort. Mouse rubber wears off with use.
Installation may require multiple attempts due to software issues.
Overall, comfortable and stylish with more features than needed.
